topic.title: How to Add a Group of Topics to the Footer

body.p: Let see how to create a footer on only the last page, that contains the content of several topic files.

section.title: Using the position:fixed CSS Property

ol.li:
Group all the footer topics under a single parent topic, under the last topic from your DITA map. For example you can have the following map structure:
... End topic Footer container topic Footer content topic 1 Footer content topic 2.
Put an outputclass=footer on the topic root element of the footer container topic, or on its topicref in the map.

section.note: Make sure the width and height are enough for the content of the footer to fit. Take care, the content might bleed out of the page! Use bottom and left values to position the block in the page.

section.title: Using the float:footnote CSS Property
section.p: The second approach would be to declare the footer block as a footnote. Assuming the same DITA Map structure as above
section.note: Use transparent colors and/or zero size font to avoid the display of the footnote counters.
